Users cannot self-assign leads (configurable)
Work order must have a customer and service location
A BOM must have at least one component
Campaigns cannot target same lead more than once per day (configurable)
A requisition MUST have at least one line item
A project MUST have a project manager assigned
The sequence name/ID is unique per scope_identifier (composite key)
column7: Fully implemented and tested

column4: All state changes must be ACID-compliant
Cannot assign work order to technician without required skills
BOM components cannot reference the parent product (circular BOM prevention)
All state changes must be ACID transactions
Requisition total estimate MUST equal sum of line item estimates
A task MUST belong to a project
A generated number must be immutable. Once generated and consumed, it cannot be changed
column7: Fully implemented and tested

column4: Stale leads auto-escalate after configured timeout
Cannot start work order without assignment to technician
Only one BOM per product can be active at a time
Low ROI campaigns auto-escalate after configured threshold
Approved requisitions cannot be edited (only cancelled)
Timesheet hours cannot be negative or exceed 24 hours per day per user
Pattern variables must be padded if a padding size is specified in the pattern (e.g., {COUNTER:5})
column7: Fully implemented and tested

column4: Compensation activities execute in reverse order
Work order can only be completed if all critical checklist items pass
Work order quantity completed + quantity scrapped cannot exceed quantity ordered
Compensation actions execute in reverse order of original actions
A purchase order MUST reference an approved requisition OR be explicitly marked as direct PO
Approved timesheets are immutable (cannot be edited or deleted)
The manual override of a sequence value must be greater than the last generated number
column7: Fully implemented and tested

column4: Delegation chain maximum depth: 3 levels
Parts consumption auto-deducts from technician van stock first, then warehouse
Materials can only be issued to work orders in "released" or "in_production" status
Delegation chain maximum depth: 3 levels
PO total amount MUST NOT exceed requisition approved amount by more than 10% without re-approval
A task's actual hours MUST equal the sum of all approved timesheet hours for that task
The counter is only incremented *after* a successful database lock and generation, not during preview
column7: Fully implemented and tested

column4: Level 1 code remains compatible after Level 2/3 upgrades
Service report can only be generated after work order is completed
Work order cannot be completed if material allocations are not fulfilled
Phase 1 configurations remain compatible with Phase 2/3
GRN quantity cannot exceed PO quantity for any line item
Milestone billing amount cannot exceed remaining project budget (for fixed-price projects)
The package is only responsible for the Unique Base Identifier. Sub-identifiers (copies, versions, spawns) are the responsibility of the application layer
column7: Fully implemented and tested

column4: One CRM instance per subject model
Customer signature is required before work order can be marked verified
Operation sequence must be sequential (operation 10 before operation 20)
One marketing instance per model/entity
3-way match tolerance rules are configurable per tenant
Resource allocation percentage cannot exceed 100% per user per day
Parallel branches must all complete before proceeding
SLA deadlines calculated from service contract terms
Inspection must pass before work order can be completed
Parallel channels must all complete before proceeding
Payment authorization requires successful 3-way match OR manual override by authorized user
Task dependencies must not create circular references
Assignment checks delegation chain first
SLA breach triggers escalation workflow (notify manager, auto-reassign)
Quarantined batches cannot be used in production or sold
Campaign assignment checks delegation chain first
Requester cannot approve their own requisition
Project status cannot be "completed" if there are incomplete tasks
Preventive maintenance work orders auto-generated 7 days before due date
Standard cost must be calculated before work order release
Multi-team approval uses configured strategy
PO creator cannot create GRN for the same PO
Timesheet billing rate defaults to resource allocation rate for the project
Cannot schedule technician beyond their daily capacity (8 hours default)
MRP must consider safety stock levels when calculating net requirements
GDPR consent required for EU leads
GRN creator cannot authorize payment for the same PO
Client stakeholders can view only their own projects
GPS location capture required when starting/ending job
Batch genealogy must be captured for all regulated products (pharma, food)
Unsubscribe respected across all campaigns
Blanket PO releases cannot exceed blanket PO total committed value
Revenue recognition for fixed-price projects based on % completion or milestone approval
Asset must have maintenance schedule if covered by service contract
Lot/serial numbers must be unique across all tenants (globally unique)
Lead scoring updates trigger segment recalculation
Vendor quote must be submitted before RFQ deadline to be considered valid
Earned value calculations require baseline (planned) values to be set
Expired service contracts prevent new work order creation (unless emergency)
Work center capacity cannot be exceeded without approval
A/B test traffic distribution must total 100%
Tax calculation based on vendor jurisdiction and tax codes from nexus-tax-management
Lessons learned can only be created after project status = completed or cancelled
Route optimization respects job time windows (scheduled start/end times)
Routing operations must reference active work centers
All procurement amounts must be in tenant's base currency OR converted at transaction date exchange rate
Timesheet approval requires user to have approve-timesheet permission for the project
All journal entries MUST be balanced (debit = credit) before posting
Posted entries cannot be modified; only reversed with offsetting entries
Prevent deletion of accounts with associated transactions or child accounts
Account codes MUST be unique within tenant scope
Only leaf accounts (no children) can have transactions posted to them
Entries can only be posted to active fiscal periods; closed periods reject entries
Foreign currency transactions MUST record both base and foreign amounts with exchange rate
Three-way matching required for vendor invoice posting (PO, GR, Invoice)
Customer payments MUST be allocated to specific invoices for proper aging tracking
Users cannot view sensitive data about themselves
All query executions MUST use ACID transactions
Predictive model drift MUST trigger automatic alerts
Failed queries MUST use compensation actions for reversal
Delegation chains limited to maximum 3 levels depth
Level 1 definitions MUST remain compatible after L2/3 upgrade
Each model instance has one analytics instance
Parallel data sources MUST complete all before returning results
Delegated access MUST check delegation chain for permissions
Multi-role sharing follows configured strategy (unison/selective)
Audit logs MUST include log_name, description, and timestamp at minimum
Audit level MUST be one of: 1 (Low), 2 (Medium), 3 (High), 4 (Critical)
Retention days CANNOT be negative; default retention is 90 days
System activities (cron jobs, queue workers, CLI commands) are logged with causer_type = null
High-value entity changes (users, roles, permissions, financial records) default to Critical level

Expired logs (past retention period) are purged automatically via scheduled job
Parent company must be active to have active children
Office hierarchy cannot exceed company boundaries
Department hierarchy independent of office structure
Staff can only have one primary supervisor per company
Supervisor must be in same or parent organizational unit
Staff transfer requires approval from authorized users
Transfer effective dates cannot be retroactive beyond 30 days
Unit membership transcends traditional hierarchy boundaries
Staff codes must be unique system-wide
Company codes must be unique across the system
Employees MUST have active contract before leave accrual begins
Leave requests CANNOT exceed available balance unless negative balance policy enabled
Probation completion required before permanent leave entitlements activate

Performance reviews MUST be conducted by employee's direct manager or authorized delegate
Disciplinary actions require documented evidence and approval workflow completion

Employee termination MUST trigger automatic leave balance calculation and final settlement

Only locked pay runs can generate payslips and post to accounting

EIS contributions required for employees earning below RM4,000 per month
Payslip data MUST be immutable once generated (regeneration creates new record)

Record before/after state for all model updates
Capture user context (who performed the action) with IP address, user agent, and timestamp
Support tenant-based isolation of audit logs
Provide full-text search across descriptions and properties
Filter logs by date range, user, entity type, entity ID, and event type
Export audit logs to CSV, JSON, and PDF formats
Mask sensitive fields (passwords, tokens, secrets) automatically
Support batch operations with UUID grouping for related activities
Configurable retention policies with automated purging of expired logs
Support multiple audit levels (Low, Medium, High, Critical) for risk-based filtering
Asynchronous logging via queue to prevent performance impact
Event-driven architecture with notifications for high-value activities
RESTful API endpoints for log retrieval, search, and export
Activity statistics and reporting (total counts, counts by log name, trends over time)

Provide immutable Quantity Value Object that encapsulates numeric value and base UoM (primary API entry point)
column5: packages/Uom/src/ValueObjects/Quantity.php (readonly class with value and unitCode properties)

column4: Support simple multiplication/division conversions using only a defined ratio without complex dimension definitions
Implement service method to check if two Quantity objects are convertible before attempting operation
Support standard arithmetic operations (add, subtract, multiply, divide) of Quantity objects with automatic conversion
Provide formatting method to display quantity based on user/system locale settings (decimal, thousand separators)
Support definition of Dimensions (Mass, Length, Time) to group and validate units
Implement conversion graph engine to find shortest path between any two convertible units using Dimension validation
Support grouping of units into Systems (Metric, Imperial) for reporting and regional consistency
Each Dimension MUST define a single Base Unit (e.g., meter for Length) as intermediary for conversions
Support complex conversions involving offset (e.g., Celsius to Fahrenheit: F = C × 1.8 + 32)
Support packaging hierarchies (1 Pallet → 10 Cases → 100 Eaches) with fractional relationships
Provide service to convert quantity of packages to base unit equivalent (5 Cases of 100 Eaches → 500 Eaches)
Quantity Value Object MUST be easily serializable to JSON/array formats for storage and inter-package communication
Quantity Value Object MUST be immutable once created to prevent accidental modification
Direct conversions between units MUST validate that units share the same Dimension before attempting conversion
Invalid conversion attempts MUST throw IncompatibleUnitException with clear error message
Conversion ratios MUST be positive non-zero values to prevent invalid calculations
Each UoM MUST be assigned to exactly one Dimension for proper categorization
Base Unit for a Dimension CANNOT be changed once units are defined to prevent broken conversions
Conversion graph MUST prevent circular conversion paths that could cause infinite loops
All conversions within a Dimension MUST route through the Dimension's Base Unit as intermediary
Offset conversions MUST only be allowed for Temperature dimension to prevent misuse
Unit codes MUST be unique across the entire system to prevent ambiguity
Packaging relationships MUST form a directed acyclic graph (no circular packaging)
Fractional packaging ratios MUST be positive to ensure valid conversions
Simple direct conversion (A to B with defined ratio) MUST complete in < 5ms
Complex multi-hop conversion (up to 5 conversions) MUST complete in < 20ms
Quantity arithmetic operations (add, subtract) MUST complete in < 10ms including conversion
Conversion path calculation SHOULD cache results for repeated conversions
System MUST support at least 1,000 defined units without performance degradation
Unit definitions MUST enforce tenant isolation if multi-tenancy is enabled
Custom unit creation MUST be audited with creator and timestamp
Conversion ratio modifications MUST be versioned to maintain audit trail
System units (predefined) CANNOT be deleted or modified to ensure data integrity
Conversion calculations MUST use arbitrary precision math to prevent rounding errors
Division by zero in conversions MUST throw InvalidConversionRatioException
Invalid arithmetic operations on incompatible units MUST fail fast with clear error message
Conversion graph pathfinding MUST handle disconnected graphs gracefully
